name: Super Duper Party Pooper
description: Have you ever wanted to poop on party goers but were too socially awkward to just go for it? Well, Super Duper Party Pooper is about to change all that. In this follow up to the smash hit There’s Poop In My Soup by Rudder Games the player will find themselves in the middle of a raw human story of existential panic.
minimum_requirements: OS: 7, 8 Processor: 2GHz Graphics: 512MB DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 500 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: 7, 8 Processor: 2GHz Graphics: 512MB DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: i lost my ♥♥♥♥ when a bass dropped on 3rd level
This game, with it's epic music and fun gameplay, it is worth the price!  I would say, 10/10 would eat to a beat and poop again.
It´s a really funny game!  Do not try in Reallife! ;)  !DANGER!

This game is terrible!  TERRIBLY FUN! :-D  One part rythm, one part artillery, ALL PARTS POOPIN'!  The game isn't perfect, though. The rhythm element with the included music is often off (really badly in the last level), and the desserts (green dot(s)) only add to the score and not the 'ammo'. Custom music can be used, but you have to manually enter in the file path and beats per minute. Yeah, it's a little rough, but it's hard to have this much fun for so little money!
As a sh☭tting-fetishist and enthusiast of the previous game   There's poop in my soup   I can highly recommend the successor of a wonderful masterpiece.

This game is best to play when you yourself have to poop!!! The difficulty factor goes up 10 fold!!!! Being able to add your own music while playing a game never hurts.         YouTube™ Video:  Super Duper Party Pooper (Steam)
What a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game. But I will give it a 10 out of 10 WOULD ♥♥♥♥ AGAIN
A rhythm game where the rhythm is off.   Fantastic.

DISCLAIMER: Too bad there is no neutral on Steam reviews, this would be one  After playing 'There's Poop in my soup', i was expecting another fun poop simulator, however, you probably noticed that this is quite in fact a rhythm game. That in itself would not have been a problem, but when i played it, the game was really broken and it was hard to keep up with the pace. Keep in mind that i played the game when it was first released, issues might have been patched. Still prefer the previous game though!          YouTube™ Video:  THIS GAME BROKE MY SANITY!!! | Super Duper Party Pooper [Playthrough]
